Module kukumo.core
Package iti.kukumo.api

Interface Backend

  • public interface Backend
    The backend is the piece which actually runs the tests. It is usually created by a BackendFactory from the context information regarding a test case (available contributors, test case configuration, etc.). A new backend instance should be created each time a test case is executed, in order to ensure isolation in multi-thread environments.

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        void setUp()
        Perform set-up operations prior to run any step. Usually, those operations correspond to StepContributor methods annotated with SetUp

      • tearDown

        void tearDown()
        Perform set-up operations prior to run any step. Usually, those operations correspond to StepContributor methods annotated with TearDown

      • runStep

        void runStep​(PlanNode modelStep)
        Run a plan node of type NodeType.STEP, updating its ExecutionState with the results.
        Parameters:
        modelStep - The step to be executed.
        Throws:
        KukumoException - when the given node is not suitable for being executed.

      • getTypeRegistry

        KukumoDataTypeRegistry getTypeRegistry()
        Exposes information about the type registry used by the backend

      • getAvailableSteps

        List<String> getAvailableSteps​(Locale locale,
                               boolean includeVariations)
        Obtain a list of all steps from any available step contributor used by the backend. If a step uses data type with variations (like assertions), a new element would be presented for each variation.
        Parameters:
        locale - The language used to describe the steps
        includeVariations - Set whether every variation for data types should be included
        Returns:
        A list with the available steps (empty if none present)

      • getSuggestionsForInvalidStep

        List<String> getSuggestionsForInvalidStep​(String invalidStep,
                                          Locale locale,
                                          int numberOfHints,
                                          boolean includeVariations)
        Given an invalid step, obtain a list of valid suggestions. The result would be sorted by string proximity with the original step, being the first element the one with the higher probability to solve the problem. If a step uses data type with variations (like assertions), a new element would be presented for each variation.
        Parameters:
        invalidStep - The original (invalid) step
        locale - The language used
        numberOfHints - How many suggestions should be obtained
        includeVariations - Set whether every variation for data types should be included
        Returns:
        A list of suggestions (empty if none present)

      • getHintFor

        String getHintFor​(String wrongStep,
                  Locale locale)
        Given an invalid step, obtain a message with the most probable solutions. This is intended to be used as a part of an error message or diagnostics.
        Parameters:
        invalidStep - The original (invalid) step
        locale - The language used
        Returns:
